posts.title: Various-The Joy of Sex Education: 1917-1973
posts.excerpt: Quote: From the impenetrably euphemistic to the breathtakingly explicit, this intriguing anthology takes us through 60 yearsof sex education in Britain from the 1910s to the 1970s.All ‘unmentionable matters’ pertaining to sex are dealt with, from the WW1 warning to soldiers about the dangers of cavorting with loose women in London’s West End, Whatsoever a …

posts._title: Bruno Corbucci – Quando gli uomini armarono la clava e… con le donne fecero din-don AKA When Women Played Ding Dong (1971)
posts.title: Quando gli uomini armarono la clava e… con le donne fecero din-don
posts.excerpt: Description: Ever hear the classic Greek tale of Lysistrata? Well this is the comedic stone-age version. A tournament is taking place between the male cave-dwellers and the male water-dwellers. The beautiful Listra is prize to the victor Ari. Got is a sore loser and he spitefully cuts off the water supply to the cave-dwellers and …

posts.title: 7 Women
posts.excerpt: Plot John Ford’s final film is set in China in 1935, where a group of American women, led by Agatha Andrews (Margaret Leighton), work as missionaries. One of the women, Florrie (Betty Field), is pregnant and accompanied by her husband, Charles (Eddie Albert), while the others are single and on their own. The mission has …

posts.title: Mother Machree
posts.excerpt: PLOT SUMMARY and OTHER INFORMATION from Waldo’s announce Reels one, two and five — all that survives, unfortunately, of this late silent film by John Ford, though it’s enough to suggest that it might have been a major work. posts._title: Joseph M. Newman – Twenty Plus Two (1961)
posts.title: Twenty Plus Two
posts.excerpt: IMDB: The plot of this near-noir is very convoluted, but the director keeps a steady pace and there is enough incidental interest to avoid confusion or boredom. When a Hollywood secretary is found murdered, Tom Alder (Janssen), a “finder of missing persons”, is hired to investigate the murder, but quickly sees a link between the …

posts._title: Michael Haneke – Wer war Edgar Allan? (1984)
posts.title: Wer war Edgar Allan?
posts.excerpt: Quote: Wer war Edgar Allan? (Who Was Edgar Allan?). 1984. Austria/West Germany. Directed by Michael Haneke. With Paulus Manker, Rolf Hoppe. Based on the novel by noted Austrian writer Peter Rosei, who draws on Poe’s themes of doubling, shadowing, and the uncanny, this atmospheric mystery, set in Venice over four distinct seasons, follows a German …

posts.title: Variation
posts.excerpt: Haneke depicts the emotional story of an adulterous relationship between a journalist and a teacher. The film poignantly explores the difficult dynamics between people who love one another but still can’t keep from hurting one another. Variation has been described by its director as being closer to John Cassavetes than to Hollywood melodrama.

posts._title: István Szabó – Édes Emma, drága Böbe – vázlatok, aktok aka Sweet Emma, Dear Böbe – Sketches, Nudes (1992)
posts.title: Édes Emma, drága Böbe – vázlatok, aktok
posts.excerpt: Emma has moved to Budapest from the countryside with her good friend Böbe, and both of them have taken jobs as schoolteachers. However, their wages are pitifully small, and all they can afford in the way of housing is a shared room in a boarding house near the airport. The two women have settled into …

posts.title: Lemminge, Teil 2 Verletzungen
posts.excerpt: Description from the University of Massachussetts website: This two-part drama examines the fate of Haneke’s own generation which came of age after World War II. The first part depicts the generational gap between 1950s teenagers and their parents while the second shows this same group of characters twenty years later as they have grown up …

posts.title: Lemminge, Teil 1 Arkadien
posts.excerpt: Haneke unplugged – consistent themes, early, bare-bones exploration. The dark mood is set in the first scene: the vandalizing of cars. At once a deeply anti-bourgeois impulse and an act that expresses the faceless anomie of the post-war generation, this film is a melodramatic exploration of teenage resistance to overbearing parents and the constricting influence …
